query: What areas are computational linguists work incorporated today?
output: The areas where computational linguists work are incorporated today include speech recognition systems, text-to-speech synthesizers, automated voice response systems, web search engines, text editors, and language instruction materials.

query: What are the time boundaries for early registration, late registration and on-site registration?
output: Early registration ends on Sunday, June 18, 2023, at 11:59 PM (EDT). Late registration starts on Monday, June 19 and ends on Friday, July 7, 2023, at 11:59 PM (EDT). On-site registration begins on Saturday, July 8, 2023.

query: What are the potential topics of interest for the Industry Track at ACL 2023?
output: The potential topics of interest for the Industry Track at ACL 2023 include best practices and lessons learned from real world implementations. Additionally, opinion/vision papers related to real-world applications are also welcomed. The track is open to all areas of speech and natural language processing technologies and systems that are relevant to real-word applications. The primary focus is on papers that advance the understanding and demonstrate the effective handling of practical issues related to the deployment of language processing technologies in non-trivial real-world systems.

query: What is Alison Gopnik’s area of expertise, and what important contributions has she made to her field?
output: Alison Gopnik is an expert in psychology and philosophy. She has made significant contributions to cognitive science and children’s learning and development. She is one of the founders of the field of “theory of mind” and has originated the “theory of cognitive development.” She was the first to apply Bayesian probabilistic models to children's learning. In addition to her contributions to academic research, she has written or co-authored several influential books and articles on cognitive science and psychology, and her work is widely recognized in her field.

query: What is the Association for Computational Linguistics?
output: The Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL) is the premier international scientific and professional society for people working on computational problems involving human language, a field often referred to as either computational linguistics or natural language processing (NLP). The association was founded in 1962, originally named the Association for Machine Translation and Computational Linguistics (AMTCL), and became the ACL in 1968. Activities of the ACL include the holding of an annual meeting each summer and the sponsoring of the journal Computational Linguistics, published by MIT Press.

query: Who are the Industry Track Chairs for the ACL 2023 conference and how to contact them?
output: The Industry Track Chairs for the ACL2023 conference are Beata Beigman Klebanov from Educational Testing Service (USA), Sunayana Sitaram from Microsoft Research (India), and Jason Williams from Apple (USA). They can be contacted at acl-2023-industry-track-pcs@googlegroups.com. Individual contacts are also available: Beata Beigman Klebanov can be contacted at bbeigmanklebanov@ets.org, and Jason Williams can be contacted at jasondwilliams@gmail.com.

query: What are some of Geoffrey Hinton's professional recognitions?
output: Geoffrey Hinton is a fellow of the UK Royal Society and a foreign member of the US National Academy of Engineering, the US National Academy of Sciences and the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. His awards include the David E. Rumelhart prize, the IJCAI award for research excellence, the Killam prize for Engineering, the Royal Society Royal Medal, the NSERC Herzberg Gold Medal, the IEEE James Clerk Maxwell Gold medal, the NEC C&C award, the BBVA award, the Honda Prize and the Turing Award.

query: Who are the Program Chairs of the ACL2023 Organizing Committee and where are they from?
output: The Program Chairs of the ACL2023 Organizing Committee are Jordan Lee Boyd-Graber from the University of Maryland (USA), Naoaki Okazaki from the Tokyo Institute of Technology (Japan), and Anna Rogers from the University of Copenhagen (Denmark).

query: Is it possible to present my paper virtually at the main conference and the workshops, or to participate in the conference virtually?
output: Yes, it is possible to present your paper virtually at the main conference and the workshops, as well as participate in the conference virtually. The conference is designed to be hybrid, accommodating both on-site and virtual presentations, with an emphasis on encouraging interaction between the online and in-person modalities.

query: What should I do if I require caregiving expenses during the conference?
output: You can apply for a caregiving and accessibility subsidy. State in your application how much you require to cover expenses necessary at the time of the conference such as babysitting, transportation costs, or other support required for yourself or your dependents. If you need any personal or technical assistance due to a disability, this can also be reimbursed. For your expenses to be reimbursed, you need to provide receipts.

query: How can one obtain an invitation letter for the ACL 2023 conference?
output: One can obtain an invitation letter for the ACL 2023 conference by applying in the form provided under the Participants Information section. It is required that the person has submitted a paper to the main conference ACL 2023 as an author or co-author and their Softconf ID is associated with the submission.

query: What is the introduction content regarding the ACL 2023 conference sponsors?
output: ACL 2023 is extremely grateful to all sponsors. We simply couldn’t run the conference without the help of these generous organizations. We thank them sincerely for their ongoing support of the NLP/CL community. If your organization would like to sponsor ACL or other conferences in the ACL family, please refer to our Invitation to Sponsors for information about sponsorship rates and benefits.

query: Who are given preference for the Travel and Accommodation Subsidies?
output: Preference for the Travel and Accommodation Subsidies is given to authors, first-time attendees, and folks from underrepresented communities with financial hurdles. Preference is also given to applicants who are presenting a paper at the main conference, the Student Research Workshop, or any of the workshops associated with ACL, and those who do not have other means of support.

query: What is the schedule for the conference and the workshops at the ACL 2023?
output: The exact schedule for the conference and the workshops at ACL 2023 is not provided in the given context. However, the workshop dates are listed as July 13-14, 2023. Various important dates throughout the year leading up to the conference are also mentioned, such as proposal deadlines and other preparations. Specific session times or daily schedules for the conferences or workshops are not included in the provided information.

query: What are the ethical considerations for paper submissions?
output: The ethical considerations for paper submissions include complying with the ACL Code of Ethics. Authors are encouraged to include an explicit ethics statement on the broader impact of the work, or other ethical considerations after the conclusion but before the references. When a paper might raise ethical issues, it should include an explicit discussion of these issues for the review process. Papers working with sensitive data or on sensitive tasks that do not discuss these ethical issues will not be accepted. Further, the mere inclusion of an ethical considerations section does not guarantee acceptance. Papers may also receive a conditional acceptance recommendation, which would necessitate further review by the ethics committee to determine if concerns have been adequately addressed.

query: What tasks may student volunteers be required to do for ACL 2023?
output: Student volunteers for ACL 2023 may be required to assist at the registration desk, fill delegate packs, manage poster board sessions and displays, serve as a volunteer coordinator for the day, and provide AV/technical support. This support may include managing social media (like Twitter) and providing assistance for conference events including tutorials, the main conference, and workshops. These tasks can be for either online or in-person versions of the event.

query: What are the requirements for the mandatory abstract submission?
output: The requirements for the mandatory abstract submission include the paper title, author names, contact details, and a brief abstract. These must be submitted electronically through the ACL 2023 paper submission site by the abstract submission deadline, which is January 13. Minor edits to the title and abstract can be made until the full paper submission deadline, but changes to authors and subject areas are not permitted. Submissions with “placeholder” abstracts will be removed without consideration.

query: What is the policy on multiple submission for papers under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023?
output: The policy allows an exception for papers under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023 to be submitted to ACL as well. However, this must be declared at submission time. If the work is accepted, it must be withdrawn from ACL no later than January 31 for EACL 2023, and no later than January 22 for ICLR 2023. Papers submitted to ICLR 2023 and ACL 2023 must also follow the anonymization policy of ACL 2023.

query: Can I submit the same paper to another conference that is currently under review elsewhere (e.g. at EACL)?
output: In principle, papers submitted directly to ACL must not be under review for any other archival venue at any time during the ACL review process. However, there is an exception for work under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023. These can be submitted to ACL concurrently, but must be declared at submission time. If the work is accepted, it must be withdrawn from ACL no later than January 31 (when accepted to EACL 2023) and no later than January 22 (when accepted to ICLR 2023).

query: What is the new award policy implemented by ACL2023?
output: The new award policy implemented by ACL2023 aims for broader recognition of exceptional research by significantly increasing the pool of outstanding papers to 1.5-2.5% of the total submissions. This includes a total of 3 best papers, 4 special awards papers (Resource Award, Social Impact Award, Reproduction Award, Theme Paper Award) and 39 outstanding papers. Additionally, there are Area Chair Awards, where the Senior Area Chairs of each track have the opportunity to nominate one of their papers for a separate award.

query: What does the Full Conference In-person Registration Fee Include?
output: The Full Conference In-person Registration Fee includes admission to all in-person meeting sessions and the exhibition as well as the entire virtual program, attendance to all recorded sessions on demand for at least one month following the meeting, a conference bag and materials, tea and coffee breaks throughout the meeting, admission to the Welcome Reception on Sunday 9th of July at The Westin Harbour Castle, Metropolitan Ballroom including light canapes and a welcome drink, and admission to the Social Dinner on Tuesday 11th July at The Steam Whistle Brewer, including buffet dinner.

query: Who are the intended recipients for Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration?
output: The intended recipients for Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration are researchers who otherwise would be unable to participate in ACL events due to financial constraints. The selection for financial aid will consider the applicant's country of residence, employment position, monthly income range, available financial support from the employer/university, and special circumstances. Prioritization is given to those in the greatest financial need, and generally, this funding is not intended for employed individuals and funded students from USA, Canada, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, and higher income countries in Asia and the Middle East.

query: What kind of proposals are invited for the tutorials at the EACL 2023, ACL 2023, and EMNLP 2023 conferences?
output: The EACL 2023, ACL 2023, and EMNLP 2023 conferences are inviting proposals for two types of tutorials. The first type is Cutting-edge tutorials, which cover advances in newly emerging areas not previously covered in any related tutorial from the specified organizations. The second type is Introductory tutorials, that provide introductions to related fields that might be relevant for the computational linguistics community, such as linguistics, bioinformatics, and machine learning techniques. The aim of these tutorials is to help understand a scientific problem, its tractability, and its theoretical and practical implications.

query: What are the responsibilities of the organizers of the accepted proposals?
output: The organizers of the accepted proposals are responsible for publicizing and running the workshop, which includes reviewing submissions, producing the camera-ready workshop proceedings, organizing the meeting days, and ensuring all participants are aware of ACL’s anti-harassment policy. They should adhere to all deadlines, as failure to produce the camera-ready proceedings on time could result in the workshop being excluded from the proceedings and author indexes. They cannot accept submissions for publication that will be (or have been) published elsewhere, although they can set their own policies on simultaneous submission and review. Organizers need to follow the submission, reviewing, and preparation timeline for each conference, deviating only when absolutely necessary and with explicit agreement from the relevant Workshop Chairs.

query: What are the possible topics for discussion under the theme track 'Reality Check'?
output:
The possible topics of discussion under the theme track 'Reality Check' include:

1. How reliably do the leaderboard scores translate to improvements in real-world use of the models?
2. How reliably do the leaderboard scores compare competing models?
3. What tasks can the NLP systems claim to have “solved”, if any?
4. Have performance improvements been accompanied by growth in the scientific understanding (of language, cognition, or deep learning technology)? In what ways?
5. What can the NLP venues do to improve reporting?
6. Right for the wrong reasons
7. Lessons from deployment
8. Generalizability and non-generalizability
9. Reproducibility and non-reproducibility
10. Evaluation
11. Methodology
12. Negative results
13. AI hype & expectations
14. Science vs engineering
15. Lessons from other fields
16. Forgotten lessons.

query: What is the anti-harassment policy at ACL events?
output: The anti-harassment policy at ACL events includes maintaining an environment that recognizes the inherent worth of every person and group, fosters dignity, understanding, and mutual respect, and embraces diversity. Harassment and hostile behavior are unwelcome. This includes speech or behavior that intimidates, creates discomfort, or interferes with a person’s participation or opportunity for participation in a conference or an event. ACL-related activities aim to be an environment where any form of harassment does not occur, including those based on race, gender, religion, age, color, appearance, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Harassment may also include degrading verbal comments, deliberate intimidation, stalking, harassing photography or recording, inappropriate physical contact, and unwelcome sexual attention. Vexatious complaints and willful misuse of the policy may also lead to sanctions. Violations should be reported to the Professional Conduct Committee.

query: What are the guidelines about video submission for the system demonstration?
output:
The guidelines for video submission for the system demonstration are as follows: 

- The video should be short, no more than 2 minutes long.
- The video should demonstrate the system and its functionality. 
- The video can be a screencast with audio narration which is a natural choice for demos that can be presented on a screen. Alternatively, a video showing a user interacting with the system can be used.
- The production quality of the video is not considered important, and the video can be a simple screencast of the software being demoed with zero to minimal editing efforts.
- It is recommended to publish the video on YouTube or another website and include the link in the paper. If one prefers not to publicly upload a screencast, the video (in MPEG4 format) can be submitted as supplementary material through START while submitting the paper.
  
Note: The video will be used to evaluate the paper, but it will not be published unless requested.

query: What is the cancelation policy of the conference?
output:
The cancellation policy of the conference indicates that full refund will be given for cancellations made one month or more prior to the conference (by June 09, 2023), subject to a potential $50 processing fee. If the cancellation is done up to three weeks before the conference (by June 16, 2023), the registrant will be refunded the ACL membership (if paid as part of the registration) and any amounts paid beyond the first $200. Cancellations made two weeks prior to the start of the conference (by June 23, 2023), and all no-shows, will not be refunded any amount, although they will be able to retain the current full-year ACL membership (if paid as part of the registration) and have virtual access.

However, exceptions are made for cancellations due to governmental travel restrictions, failure to obtain a visa, or serious illness preventing travel to the conference. In these cases, a full refund will be given, regardless of when the notification is received by the ACL Office (subject to up to a $50 processing fee), provided documentation supporting the reasons for cancellation is submitted.

query: What is the multiple submission policy of the ACL 2023?
output:
The multiple submission policy of the ACL 2023 stipulates that any paper currently under review in a journal or at another conference cannot be considered. The submitted papers must not be submitted elsewhere during the ACL 2023 review period. This policy applies to all refereed and archival conferences and workshops, and ACL Rolling Reviews. A paper will not be considered if it significantly overlaps in content or results with papers to be published or already published elsewhere. Authors submitting more than one paper to ACL 2023 must ensure their submissions do not overlap significantly (>25%) in content or results.

Also, submissions of identical or closely related work to multiple ACL 2023 tracks will be treated as duplicate submissions and will be rejected without review. Authors should include the papers their submission overlaps or extends with in the references section.

In principle, papers submitted directly to ACL must not be under review for any other archival venue during the ACL review process. However, an exception is made for works under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023, to account for overlapping submission due and notification of acceptance dates. These works can be submitted to ACL but must be declared at submission time and withdrawn from ACL no later than January 31 (for EACL 2023) or January 22 (for ICLR 2023) if accepted. Papers submitted to ICLR 2023 and ACL 2023 must also adhere to the anonymization policy of ACL 2023.
